info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 5:53PM EDT until July 14 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL RAPPAHANNOCK...CENTRAL FAUQUIER AND NORTH CENTRAL CULPEPER COUNTIES... At 553 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles west of Warrenton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Warrenton, Turnbull, Amissville and Jeffersonton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
